law.catch_line: With the advice and consent of the Senate, the Governor shall appoint an Administrator of the boards...

text.section: With the advice and consent of the Senate, the Governor shall appoint an Administrator of the boards for a term of 6 years.
The Administrator is entitled to the salary and necessary assistance as provided in the State budget.

In addition to the powers and duties set forth elsewhere in this article, the Administrator shall:
prepare and provide notices and reports required of boards including uniform forms, order blanks, and statements advising taxpayers of their right to appeal;
keep a record of complaints about the conduct or fitness of members; and
forward to the appropriate county officials listed in § 3-103(d)(2) of this title complaints that would justify removal of a member.

section.section:
Subject to Title 10, Subtitles 1 and 2 of the State Government Article, the Administrator shall:
adopt uniform regulations to govern the activities of the boards; and
ensure that the regulations are applied consistently.
After adoption, regulations shall be filed with the Maryland Tax Court and Court of Appeals.
